result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik Ortega Renteria

defendant.name: Ortega Renteria, Erik

records.addlTxt:
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report immediately after signing new bond forms. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Anna P. 
- Defendant shall terminate any contact direct or indirect with Anna P upon her request. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court reporter Trisch Clark. Defendant Erik Ortega Renteria in court.  Attorney Anthony C. Delyea in court for Erik Ortega Renteria.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court for a bail/bond hearing as requested by the defense in 22CF1789 and 22CM1396. Atty Delyea gives argument. State objects and gives argument. Court grants the request to amend the bond conditions in both cases as follows: 

22CF1789 and 22CM1396- remove no contact order with Anna P and change it to no acts or threats of violence against Anna P.  -DE will terminate any contact, direct or indirect with Anna P upon her request. - DE is order to DCPS for remote breath testing. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services
Bail/bond hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
